Class GameBoard

java.lang.Object
greenfoot.World
GameBoard
public class GameBoard extends greenfoot.World
This is the physical board for my Wormhole Dash game. The gameboard acts as a level manager that controls much of the game (e.g. game logic, game state, etc.)
Version:
Final Version
Author:
bickfori@email.uscb.edu

  • Method Details

    • act

      public void act()
      Depending on the game's state, determines what the GameBoard does during each frame or cycle of the `act` method
      Overrides:
      act in class greenfoot.World

    • started

      public void started()
      Starts the background music and sets its volume to an appropriate level
      Overrides:
      started in class greenfoot.World

    • determineDieRollValueForPlayerIndex

      public void determineDieRollValueForPlayerIndex(int playerIndex)
      Determines the die roll for the current player. If the player is human, then the human player clicks on the die object to roll the die; otherwise, the die is automatically rolled by the CPU.
      Parameters:
      playerIndex - the index of the player rolling the die

    • determineDieRollBattle

      public int determineDieRollBattle(int playerIndex)
      Determines the die roll for the current player. If the player is human, then the human player clicks on the die object to roll the die; otherwise, the die is automatically rolled by the CPU. This is similiar but has key differences from the previous determine die roll method. To keep the battle die logic seperate and clear, it has its own method here for battles. Additionally, this method uses a "6-sided die".
      Parameters:
      playerIndex - the index of the player rolling the die

    • determineWhichPiecesAreMoveableForPlayerIndex

      public void determineWhichPiecesAreMoveableForPlayerIndex(int playerIndex)
      Routine for determining which reds are moveable
      Parameters:
      playerIndex - index of the player whose turn is currently active

    • determineMoveForPlayerIndex

      public void determineMoveForPlayerIndex(int playerIndex)
      Determines which of the player's moveable pieces will actually be moved
      Parameters:
      playerIndex - the index of the player currently moving

    • handleSelectedPieceForPlayerIndex

      public void handleSelectedPieceForPlayerIndex(int playerIndex, PlayerPiece selectedPlayerPiece)
      Updates the given player piece's location index along the movement path for the given playerIndex
      Parameters:
      playerIndex - the index of the player moving the selected piece
      selectedPlayerPiece - a reference to the player's selected piece

    • moveSelectedPieceOntoTargetSpaceForPlayerIndex

      public void moveSelectedPieceOntoTargetSpaceForPlayerIndex(int playerIndex, PlayerPiece selectedPlayerPiece)
      "Helper" method (called by handleSelectedPieceForPlayerIndex) for moving a piece into a target space that is NOT the goal
      Parameters:
      playerIndex - the index of the player moving a piece into the piece's target space
      selectedPlayerPiece - a reference to the player's selected piece

    • resetCapturedPieceOnBoardAndReplaceWithSelectedPieceForPlayerIndex

      public void resetCapturedPieceOnBoardAndReplaceWithSelectedPieceForPlayerIndex(int playerIndex, PlayerPiece selectedPlayerPiece)
      "Helper" method (here called by `moveSelectedPieceOntoTargetSpaceForPlayerIndex`) for handling the capture of an opposing player's piece
      Parameters:
      playerIndex - the index of the player moving a piece into that piece's target space
      selectedPlayerPiece - a reference to the player's selected piece

    • moveSelectedPieceIntoGoalZoneForPlayerIndex

      public void moveSelectedPieceIntoGoalZoneForPlayerIndex(int playerIndex, PlayerPiece selectedPlayerPiece)
      "Helper" method (here called by handleSelectedPieceForPlayerIndex) to move the selected playerPiece's SPRITE into the goal zone. Note that this only moves the player piece's SPRITE; the player piece's board location index is updated elsewhere Actual X- and Y-coordinates of each player's piece in the goal zone are each computed as a linear function of how many of that player's pieces are already in the goal zone (i.e., goalCountForPlayer[playerIndex] )
      Parameters:
      playerIndex - the index of the player moving a piece into the goal zone
      selectedPlayerPiece - a reference to the player's selected piece

    • makeAllPiecesMoveableAgainForPlayerIndex

      public void makeAllPiecesMoveableAgainForPlayerIndex(int playerIndex)
      "Turns on" (makes moveable) all of pieces for the given player (specified by `playerIndex`) at the conclusion of that player's turn
      Parameters:
      playerIndex - the index of the player that is completing their turn

    • updateGameStateAfterTurnForPlayerIndex

      public void updateGameStateAfterTurnForPlayerIndex(int playerIndex)
      Updates the game state (and checks for a possible win condition) after the player (specified by `playerIndex`) has just completed their turn
      Parameters:
      playerIndex - the index of the player that has just completed their turn

    • updateGoalCountForPlayerIndex

      public void updateGoalCountForPlayerIndex(int playerIndex)
      For the given playerIndex, checks to see how many of that player's pieces have been moved into that goal zone at the end of that player's movement path
      Parameters:
      playerIndex - the index of the player whose pieces are being checked to see if they're in the goal zone

    • determineBattleWinner

      public void determineBattleWinner(PlayerPiece attackingPiece, PlayerPiece defendingPiece)
      Determines winner of a battle and sets appropriate win/loss counters for each piece. Additionally resets the piece to the starting zone when captured. Main battle logic.
      Parameters:
      attackingPiece - identifies which piece from which player index is the attacking piece in the battle
      defendingPiece - identifies which piece from which player index is the defending piece in the battle

    • checkTier3PieceHasLost

      public void checkTier3PieceHasLost()
      Checks to see if a tier 3 piece has been lost, if so manually sets condition to switch state for the win of the opposing player

    • nameSpaces

      public void nameSpaces()
      Names the planets and stars after initialization of each space

    • displaySpaceName

      public void displaySpaceName(Space landedSpace)
      Displays the name of the planets and stars on the gameboard for the user when called
      Parameters:
      landedSpace - space on which a player piece has landed after moving

    • handleLandingOnSpace

      public void handleLandingOnSpace(PlayerPiece piece, int spaceIndex)
      When a player piece lands on a space, it displays the name for the user on the gameboard
      Parameters:
      piece - determines which piece is moving to desired space
      spaceIndex - determines which space the piece is moving to

    • nameShips

      public void nameShips()
      Names each ship after each ship has been instantiated
